title.rendered: Explore Job Roles: High School Teachers

content.rendered:
What is a High School Teacher?

High School Teachers are educators that work with high school aged students on important academic subjects.

Where do High School Teachers work?

  • Public schools
  • Private schools

How much does a High School Teacher make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for a High School Teacher is $43,000.

What majors are typically interested in becoming High School Teachers?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing this career path.

  • Education majors
  • English majors
  • Math majors
  • Science majors
Search High School Teacher jobs

High School Teacher skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring High School Teachers succeed in their work:

  • Great interpersonal skills
  • Compassion and patience
  • Ability to create and execute lesson plans

What are some common questions about High School Teachers?

Q: How many years does it take to become a High School Teacher?

A: 4-5 years.
